meanings.definition: Effort to match or surpass a person or achievement, typically through imitation.
meanings.sent1: Her emulation of her favorite singer's style made her stand out in the talent show.
meanings.sent2: The student's emulation of the teacher's kindness towards others was heartwarming.
meanings.sent3: In an emulation of a famous painting, the toddler used crayons to recreate the masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The young athlete's emulation of the Olympic champion's training routine paid off with a gold medal.
meanings.sent5: The team's emulation of their coach's dedication led them to victory in the championship game.

meanings.definition: Imitation of the function or appearance of a different system or device.
meanings.sent1: The robot's emulation of human movements was surprisingly realistic.
meanings.sent2: The software's emulation of an older operating system allowed the program to run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The child's toy car was an emulation of a real race car, complete with stickers and a spoiler.
meanings.sent4: The artist's emulation of nature's colors in the painting created a breathtaking landscape.
meanings.sent5: The watch's design was an emulation of a famous luxury brand, but at a more affordable price.

meanings.definition: The ability of a computer program or device to imitate another program or device.
meanings.sent1: The emulator's perfect emulation of the classic video game brought back nostalgic memories.
meanings.sent2: The new software's emulation of the old system allowed users to access legacy files.
meanings.sent3: The computer's emulation of a typewriter sound effect added a fun retro vibe to the writing process.
meanings.sent4: The virtual assistant's emulation of human speech patterns made interactions more natural.
meanings.sent5: The program's emulation of a real-time chat experience made it popular among users.
